articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: Scientists record never-before-seen 'ice quakes' deep inside Greenland's frozen rivers - Livescience.com
articles.description: Quakes recorded for the first time inside Greenland's biggest frozen river, the Northeast Greenland Ice Stream, suggest this river and others switch between moving jerkily and flowing like honey.
articles.content: In a first, researchers have recorded countless "ice quakes" that sporadically shake the Greenland Ice Sheet. These quakes may explain the jerky way that the island's frozen rivers move downstream to… [+3869 chars]

articles.title: Simulation shows wolves had time to self-domesticate and evolve into dogs - Phys.org

articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.title: Euclid telescope spots rare 'Einstein ring' hiding near Earth — and an ancient, unnamed galaxy behind it - Livescience.com
articles.description: Einstein predicted the existence of gravitationally-warped rings of light in 1915. Now, a new one has been discovered just a cosmic stone's throw from our own planet.
articles.content:
The Euclid space telescope
 has captured a stunning and rare "Einstein ring" magnifying light from the depths of the universe.

articles.author: Emily Cooke
articles.title: Sex leaves 'microbial traces' on genitalia, even when a condom is used — scientists call it the 'sexome' - Livescience.com
articles.description: A new study has revealed that, during sex, male and female partners leave unique microbial "imprints" on each other, even when they use a condom.
articles.content:
Male and female sexual partners leave traces of their "genital microbiomes" during intercourse, even when they use a condom, a new study suggests.
